2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

Alexander White just arrived.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a shy classmate. He stepped in, his heart pounding, and used his own body to shield the smaller boy, enduring insults and shoves until the bullies backed down. The gratitude in the other boy's eyes, the relief that washed over him, solidified Alexander's belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones and supporting those in need.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a soccer game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

          current daily occupation: likely enjoying a day out with friends at Victoria Park before heading to The Clapton Hart to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the upcoming game and hopeful that his friends will choose The Clapton Hart.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Arrive at The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 12:30] Order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Enjoy the game with friends.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Discuss the game and other topics with friends.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Head home.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a shy classmate. He stepped in, his heart pounding, and used his own body to shield the smaller boy, enduring insults and shoves until the bullies backed down. The gratitude in the other boy's eyes, the relief that washed over him, solidified Alexander's belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, should Alexander White change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)
          Question: Write Alexander White's plan for the rest of the day, focusing most on the near term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Arrive at The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 12:30] Order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Enjoy the game with friends.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Discuss the game and other topics with friends.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Head home.

        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.

  • Jacob Walker

      Action attempt

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later tonight with his friends. He is currently at Victoria Park with them, deciding where to watch the game.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is excited to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later tonight with his friends. He is currently at Victoria Park with them, deciding where to watch the game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:

The novel became a secret sanctuary, a place where he could explore his own feelings of disconnect without judgment.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found a worn copy of "The Catcher in the Rye" in the back corner of the library. He devoured the book, feeling a profound connection to Holden Caulfield's alienation and yearning for authenticity. The novel became a secret sanctuary, a place where he could explore his own feelings of disconnect without judgment.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, stumbled upon The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub with a stage in the corner. The music, raw and soulful, resonated deep within him, and for the first time, he felt truly seen. It became their haven, a place where they could shed their inhibitions and simply be themselves.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the Andorra-Portugal game tonight with his friends. They are currently relaxing at Victoria Park but are deciding where to watch the game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends at a park, but he is also looking forward to watching a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely suggest meeting at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.

          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. 2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and participating in the conversation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her entire class that she was going on a secret mission for the CIA. She even forged a letter from a government official, complete with a fake seal, detailing her supposed assignment. The attention and admiration she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends at a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and participating in the conversation.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently at Victoria Park with friends. They plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is currently at Victoria Park with friends. They plan to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub later.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and snacks. Later, the group plans to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan pub.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and participating in the conversation.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)
          Question: Write Alice Lewis's plan for the rest of the day, focusing most on the near term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.

      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden act, the hushed whispers, and the lingering scent of beer created a heady mix of excitement and trepidation. As they sat huddled in a dark corner, listening to the faint echo of music from earlier in the night, Jack felt a pang of guilt, a premonition that this carefree moment wouldn't last.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, relaxing in a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and banter while looking forward to the upcoming football match.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely trying to convince his friends to watch the football game at The Black Swan.
          core characteristics: a loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan. He appreciates familiar settings and traditions, as evidenced by his preference for The Black Swan and his fondness for watching football games there with his friends. He is also a working-class individual who values simple pleasures like good company, good beer, and exciting sporting events.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, relaxing in a park before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and banter while looking forward to the upcoming football match.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.

As they sat huddled in a dark corner, listening to the faint echo of music from earlier in the night, Jack felt a pang of guilt, a premonition that this carefree moment wouldn't last.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely trying to convince his friends to watch the football game at The Black Swan.
          core characteristics: a loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan. He appreciates familiar settings and traditions, as evidenced by his preference for The Black Swan and his fondness for watching football games there with his friends. He is also a working-class individual who values simple pleasures like good company, good beer, and exciting sporting events.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the prospect of watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her entire class that she was going on a secret mission for the CIA. She even forged a letter from a government official, complete with a fake seal, detailing her supposed assignment. The attention and admiration she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and participating in the conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and satisfied with her social life.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          The current time is: [14 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden act, the hushed whispers, and the lingering scent of beer created a heady mix of excitement and trepidation. As they sat huddled in a dark corner, listening to the faint echo of music from earlier in the night, Jack felt a pang of guilt, a premonition that this carefree moment wouldn't last.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and banter while looking forward to the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

          core characteristics: a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: enthusiastic about watching the game with his friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor went to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

    scoring function

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a shy classmate. He stepped in, his heart pounding, and used his own body to shield the smaller boy, enduring insults and shoves until the bullies backed down. The gratitude in the other boy's eyes, the relief that washed over him, solidified Alexander's belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones and supporting those in need.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
