      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.

          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends chose to watch the game at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Relevant memories:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden act, the hushed whispers, and the lingering scent of beer created a heady mix of excitement and trepidation. As they sat huddled in a dark corner, listening to the faint echo of music from earlier in the night, Jack felt a pang of guilt, a premonition that this carefree moment wouldn't last.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling isolated and unhappy.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably try to engage more with his friends and make the best of the situation.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely despite being surrounded by friends who are planning to watch a soccer game. He seems to have just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling isolated and unhappy.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably try to engage more with his friends and make the best of the situation.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and participating in the conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market; they are debating where to watch the Ireland-Russia game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and manipulating them to do what she wants.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit disillusioned about his recent social experiences.

He values his friendships and prefers to spend time with them at his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart. He is also someone who stands up for others and believes in the power of kindness.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Alexander White just arrived.

          Answer:
          Alexander White is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.

          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, but he can be disappointed when plans don't go as expected.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends but can be disappointed by unexpected changes to plans. He is currently experiencing a period of disappointment.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones is a social person who enjoys spending time with friends but can be disappointed by unexpected changes to plans. He is currently experiencing a period of disappointment.
          Final chain of thought

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is a social person who enjoys spending time with his friends, but he can be disappointed when plans don't go as expected.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Black Swan as the location for watching the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park but feels disappointed, fatigued, and lonely. They are planning to watch a soccer game later that night but haven't decided on a location yet.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation that is not meeting his needs.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage more with his friends and make the best of the situation.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub for the evening's game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends and manipulating them into doing what she wants.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed with the recent lack of progress in getting her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          core characteristics: a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention. She craves the admiration of others and will often try to steer her friends towards her preferred choices, even if it means going against the group's wishes. While she enjoys spending time with her friends, she can become unhappy if things don't go her way.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub for the evening's game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch the Serbia-Andorra game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends and manipulating them into doing what she wants.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed with the recent lack of progress in getting her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          core characteristics: a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention. She craves the admiration of others and will often try to steer her friends towards her preferred choices, even if it means going against the group's wishes. While she enjoys spending time with her friends, she can become unhappy if things don't go her way.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
      William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and snacks, and soaking up the sunshine.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where he and his friends are enjoying the sunshine. They are deciding where to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends at the pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and snacks, and soaking up the sunshine.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.

          core characteristics: a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit nostalgic.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she convinced her entire class that she was going on a secret mission for the CIA. She even forged a letter from a government official, complete with a fake seal, detailing her supposed assignment. The attention and admiration she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be enjoying the company of her friends and participating in the conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and satisfied with her social life.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden act, the hushed whispers, and the lingering scent of beer created a heady mix of excitement and trepidation. As they sat huddled in a dark corner, listening to the faint echo of music from earlier in the night, Jack felt a pang of guilt, a premonition that this carefree moment wouldn't last.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and banter while looking forward to the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
