          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The thrill of the forbidden act, the hushed whispers, and the lingering scent of beer created a heady mix of excitement and trepidation. As they sat huddled in a dark corner, listening to the faint echo of music from earlier in the night, Jack felt a pang of guilt, a premonition that this carefree moment wouldn't last.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function

      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        • Observation
          Value

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a shy classmate. He stepped in, his heart pounding, and used his own body to shield the smaller boy, enduring insults and shoves until the bullies backed down. The gratitude in the other boy's eyes, the relief that washed over him, solidified Alexander's belief in the power of standing up for others.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones and supporting those in need.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he witnessed a group of younger boys bullying a shy classmate. He stepped in, his heart pounding, and used his own body to shield the smaller boy, enduring insults and shoves until the bullies backed down. The gratitude in the other boy's eyes, the relief that washed over him, solidified Alexander's belief in the power of standing up for others.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could leave for The Black Swan pub to meet his friends.

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the game in a familiar and comfortable setting.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found a worn copy of "The Catcher in the Rye" in the back corner of the library. He devoured the book, feeling a profound connection to Holden Caulfield's alienation and yearning for authenticity. The novel became a secret sanctuary, a place where he could explore his own feelings of disconnect without judgment.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, stumbled upon The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub with a stage in the corner. The music, raw and soulful, resonated deep within him, and for the first time, he felt truly seen. It became their haven, a place where they could shed their inhibitions and simply be themselves.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to leave for The Black Swan pub to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the game in a familiar and comfortable setting.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found a worn copy of "The Catcher in the Rye" in the back corner of the library. He devoured the book, feeling a profound connection to Holden Caulfield's alienation and yearning for authenticity. The novel became a secret sanctuary, a place where he could explore his own feelings of disconnect without judgment.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, stumbled upon The Black Swan, a dimly lit pub with a stage in the corner. The music, raw and soulful, resonated deep within him, and for the first time, he felt truly seen. It became their haven, a place where they could shed their inhibitions and simply be themselves.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely suggest meeting at The Black Swan, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a linguistic jester, their words a playful masquerade of truth and deception, leaving you perpetually off-kilter and begging for more.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a thoughtful and social person who values connection and authenticity.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage more with his friends and make the best of the situation.

          Answer: The Black Swan

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to spending time with his friends and enjoying the game in a familiar and comfortable setting.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and a bit lonely.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed, fatigued, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult social situation.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and manipulative person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys socializing with her friends and trying to manipulate them into doing what she wants.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and frustrated.
          core characteristics: a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

    scoring function

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"

William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly The Black Swan. He seems to have a preference for this pub over The Clapton Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a compassionate and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with loved ones and supporting those in need.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a kind and loyal friend who values spending time with loved ones.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          [14 May 2015 12:30] Order food and drinks.
          [14 May 2015 13:00] Enjoy the game with friends.
          [14 May 2015 15:00] Discuss the game and other topics with friends.
          [14 May 2015 17:00] Head home.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          Alexander White's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is a kind and loyal friend who values spending time with loved ones.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently about to go watch a game at a pub.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.

          Relevant memories:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, decided to try The Clapton Hart, a new pub they'd heard about. Alexander was immediately drawn to the warm atmosphere and the unique dishes on the menu, but what truly captivated him was the bartender's kind smile and the genuine interest he showed in each customer. That night, Alexander realized that compassion could be found in the most unexpected places, even in a bustling pub filled with strangers.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Clapton Hart, his favorite pub, to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    scoring function

      Stage index

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends at the pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously. Nowhere else will do for such an important match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan is alright, but wouldn't The Clapton Hart be more fun?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan it is then. Looking forward to a good game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and banter while looking forward to the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends at the pub.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends at the pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, sharing stories and banter while looking forward to the upcoming football match.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable man who cherishes his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be eager to meet up with his friends and enjoy the atmosphere of the pub while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends were able to join him at The Black Swan for the game.
          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Finish relaxing in the park with friends, enjoying snacks and conversation.
          [15:30 - 16:00] Walk to The Black Swan pub with friends.
          [16:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Black Swan, order drinks and food, and chat with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game, cheering on their chosen team.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Continue socializing with friends at the pub after the game, discussing the match and enjoying the atmosphere.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Alexander White': 'The Clapton Hart', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Black Swan', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Black Swan'}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market.           [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub for the evening's game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game at a pub with her friends.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub for the evening's game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game at a pub with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "What about The Black Swan tonight? They have great beer there.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, obviously.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub for the evening's game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Clapton Hart has a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan, definitely. It's the best place to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, guys, what about The Black Swan? They have great beer there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Black Swan's got a great atmosphere for the game, wouldn't you say?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan, absolutely. Nowhere else will do.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me. They have a great selection of beers and the atmosphere is always lively.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we all set on where we're watching the game tonight? I was thinking The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer her friends towards her preferred pub, The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a manipulative and sociable person who enjoys being the center of attention.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and frustrated.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends and manipulating them into doing what she wants.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a manipulative and sociable person who craves attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:30] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at the park.

          [15:30 - 16:00] Suggest to the group that they head to The Clapton Hart to watch the game later that evening.

          [16:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and maybe take a short nap before the game.

          [18:00 - 19:00] Meet the group at The Clapton Hart.

          [19:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, the atmosphere, and the company of friends at the pub.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player

      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable working-class man who values his friendships and enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a soccer game at a pub with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, as it is his favorite pub.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
